item.title: AI Catalog: Discover, create, and share agents and flows
item.description: üöÄ Explore the AI Catalog! Part 5 of our guide on GitLab Duo Agent Platform covers how to discover, create, and share AI agents and workflows. You can browse community-created solutions, enable them for your projects, and even customize your own agents and flows. Learn about versioning and best practices for sharing your work. üîó Dive into automation today! #GitLab #AIAgents #Automation #DevOps #TechGuide

item.title: Customizing GitLab Duo Agent Platform: Chat rules, prompts, and workflows
item.description: Unlock the potential of the GitLab Duo Agent Platform! üöÄ In Part 8 of our guide, learn how to customize AI agents and workflows for your development lifecycle. Explore user, workspace, and project-level customizations for tailored automation. Key topics include: - Custom rules for consistent agent behavior - AGENTS.md for chat behavior and standards - Extending capabilities with Model Context Protocol (MCP) - Creating custom agents and flows Start customizing today! üéØ #GitLab #AIAutomation…

item.title: Get started with GitLab Duo Agent Platform: The complete guide
item.description: üöÄ Discover the GitLab Duo Agent Platform! This new AI solution enhances the software development lifecycle by integrating intelligent agents for tasks like code refactoring and security scans. üíª The platform enables developers to collaborate with specialized agents, transforming workflows into dynamic processes. üìö Check out the comprehensive eight-part guide to get started with automation workflows. Join GitLab Transcend on February 10 to learn more about this innovative technology! #GitLab…

item.title: Getting started with GitLab Duo Agentic Chat
item.description: Unlock the power of AI with GitLab Duo Agentic Chat! ü§ñ In Part 2 of our guide, we explore this robust tool designed for seamless integration into your development lifecycle. It allows for code creation, issue management, and CI/CD pipeline support, all while keeping you informed. Learn how to access it through various platforms, select models and agents, and troubleshoot common issues. Explore more about GitLab Duo today! üéØ #GitLab #AI #Development #Automation #Coding

item.title: Introduction to GitLab Duo Agent Platform
item.description: üöÄ Introducing the GitLab Duo Agent Platform! This new AI orchestration layer enhances how developers collaborate with specialized AI agents throughout the software development lifecycle. With tools for asynchronous collaboration, multi-agent flows, and intelligent automation, you can focus on innovation while AI handles complex tasks. Explore various interaction methods, including GitLab Duo Agentic Chat and Custom Flows, for efficient workflows. üåü Ready to elevate your development process?…

item.title: Monitor, manage, and automate AI workflows
item.description: Unlock the potential of AI in your development lifecycle with Part 6 of our guide on the GitLab Duo Agent Platform. üìä Learn to manage agents and flows, set up event-driven triggers, and monitor activity through sessions. The Automate capabilities provide a streamlined hub for visibility and execution of your AI workflows. Explore now! üéØ #GitLab #AIWorkflows #Automation #DevOps #TechTips

item.title: Understanding agents: Foundational, custom, and external
item.description: üöÄ Dive into Part 3 of our guide on the GitLab Duo Agent Platform! This article explores the different types of AI agents available‚ÄîFoundational, Custom, and External. Each serves unique purposes, from general development tasks to specialized integrations. Learn how to create custom agents tailored to your workflows and discover best practices for effective use. üéØ Try GitLab Duo Agent Platform today! #GitLab #AIAgents #DevOps #Automation #SoftwareDevelopment

item.title: Understanding flows: Multi-agent workflows
item.description: üöÄ Welcome to Part 4 of the GitLab Duo Agent Platform guide! This segment focuses on “flows,” which combine multiple agents to create autonomous, multi-step workflows. Key features include: - Multi-agent orchestration: Collaborate seamlessly. - Event-driven: Triggered by specific actions. - Background execution: Work continues while flows operate. Explore foundational and custom flows for tailored automation in your projects. üîó Check it out now! #GitLab #Automation #AI #DevOps…

item.title: Strengthening GitLab.com security: Mandatory multi-factor authentication
item.description: GitLab.com is enhancing security with mandatory multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all users signing in with a username and password. üîí This initiative is part of their commitment to being “Secure by Design” and aims to protect against account takeover threats. üìà If you sign in this way, set up MFA proactively to ensure a smooth transition. Notifications will be sent out before your group is required to comply. üöÄ For those using API authentication, switching to a personal access token…

item.title: AI is reshaping DevSecOps: Attend GitLab Transcend to see what‚Äôs next
item.description: AI is changing the landscape of DevSecOps, with 34% of development work now AI-generated. However, 70% of professionals find AI complicates compliance, leading to a paradox where faster coding slows down delivery. Many teams face workflow challenges due to fragmented tools, draining valuable time. A focus on intelligent orchestration is essential to improve collaboration and efficiency. Join us at GitLab Transcend on February 10, 2026, to explore how AI can enhance partnerships between humans…

item.title: How IIT Bombay students are coding the future with GitLab
item.description: üöÄ Exciting innovations emerged at the iHack Hackathon hosted by IIT Bombay, judged by the GitLab team! Students showcased their determination to tackle real-world problems using GitLab tools. The top projects included: üèÜ Team Decode: Developed FIRE, a fast data processing tool for scientific research. They utilized GitLab Issue Boards for efficient collaboration. ü•à Team BichdeHueDost: Created SemiPay, an RFID-based cashless payment system for schools, leveraging GitLab CI/CD for a…

item.title: OWASP Top 10 2025: What's changed and why it matters
item.description: üö® The OWASP Foundation has released the 2025 edition of its “Top 10 Security Risks,” reflecting significant changes in application security. Two new categories have been added: üîπ Software Supply Chain Failures (A03) üîπ Mishandling of Exceptional Conditions (A10) Security Misconfiguration has risen to #2, while Injection and Cryptographic Failures have dropped in rank. The update emphasizes the growing complexity of software systems and the need for modern testing methods. For…

item.title: AI-powered vulnerability triaging with GitLab Duo Security Agent
item.description: üöÄ Security vulnerabilities in applications are on the rise, making effective triaging crucial for development teams. GitLab’s integrated security scanners and the GitLab Duo Security Analyst Agent streamline this process, transforming it into a more efficient workflow. üîçüí° These tools help prioritize vulnerabilities based on real risk, reducing manual effort and alert fatigue. Learn more about enhancing your vulnerability management on February 10 at GitLab Transcend. #CyberSecurity…

item.title: Building trust in agentic tools: What we learned from our users
item.description: Building trust in AI agents is essential for effective software development. GitLab’s research highlights that trust develops through “micro-inflection points”‚Äîsmall interactions that accumulate over time. Key findings include: üîë Four pillars of trust: 1. Safeguarding Actions: Ensuring safety with confirmation dialogs and rollback capabilities. 2. Providing Transparency: Clear updates and explanations help users understand AI actions. 3. Remembering Context: Retaining user…

item.title: GitLab 18.7: Advancing AI automation, governance, and developer experience
item.description: üöÄ GitLab 18.7 introduces key enhancements in development, operations, and security to improve AI integration within workflows. Key updates include the GitLab Duo Agent Platform, set for general availability in January 2026, which will streamline agentic AI management across projects. New features like Custom Flows and SAST False Positive Detection Flow aim to automate repetitive tasks and improve accuracy in security testing. Mark your calendars for the global launch event on February 10,…

item.title: Taming tool sprawl: How to boost university IT productivity
item.description: üöÄ Dr. James Quilty faced chaos in course management at Victoria University of Wellington due to scattered learning tools. By adopting GitLab in 2017, the university transformed its approach, leading to a 483% increase in student users and streamlined processes. üìà Higher education IT teams often deal with tool sprawl and legacy systems. GitLab offers a unified DevSecOps platform, allowing institutions to modernize gradually while ensuring compliance. Learn more about enhancing IT productivity…

item.title: Guide: Migrate from Azure DevOps to GitLab
item.description: üöÄ Migrating from Azure DevOps to GitLab? This guide outlines a clear process for a successful transition. Key steps include: - Use GitLab’s Congregate or built-in tools for repository migration. - Migrate CI/CD pipelines and other assets like work items and artifacts. - Plan your migration carefully by assessing timelines and structures. Ensure to run pilot migrations to validate your process before full execution. #GitLab #AzureDevOps #MigrationGuide #DevOps #SoftwareDevelopment

item.title: Automate embedded systems compliance with GitLab and CodeSonar
item.description: üöÄ Embedded systems development teams often face a trade-off between speed and compliance. The integration of GitLab with CodeSonar automates compliance workflows, allowing for continuous verification throughout the development lifecycle. This addresses the challenges of meeting stringent standards like ISO 26262 and DO-178C. The collaboration enhances code analysis, identifying vulnerabilities while maintaining audit trails, significantly improving development velocity and compliance…

item.title: How we deploy the largest GitLab instance 12 times daily
item.description: GitLab deploys code changes to GitLab.com up to 12 times daily without downtime, impacting millions of developers. Using GitLab’s CI/CD platform, we streamline feature delivery and security patches, ensuring customers have access to the latest updates quickly. üöÄ Discover how our automated deployment pipeline efficiently manages this complexity, demonstrating proven practices that support the reliability of our platform. #GitLab #DevOps #CICD #SoftwareDeployment #TechInnovation

item.title: GitLab discovers widespread npm supply chain attack
item.description: üö® GitLab’s Vulnerability Research team has uncovered a significant supply chain attack in the npm ecosystem. This campaign involves malware that spreads through infected packages, displaying worm-like behavior. The malware not only harvests credentials from various platforms but also has a destructive mechanism that can erase user data if its access channels are disrupted. üîç GitLab has confirmed that it is not affected but aims to help the security community combat this threat. Investigations…

item.description: üöÄ GitLab 18.6 introduces enhanced AI capabilities for software development. Teams gain flexibility with model selection, making workflows more efficient and secure. The GitLab Duo Planner and Security Analyst agents are now readily available, offering built-in support for planning and security. Cloud-connected users can choose AI models directly from the UI, ensuring compliance and cost management. For air-gapped environments, the Web IDE now functions offline, maintaining security without…

item.title: GitLab engineer: How I improved my onboarding experience with AI
item.description: Starting a new job can be overwhelming, but GitLab’s onboarding process, paired with GitLab Duo, has streamlined my experience as a fullstack engineer. The AI tool aids in exploration, reviewing, and debugging. It allows me to search all resources effortlessly and provides insights on edge cases before I begin coding. üõ†Ô∏è Furthermore, GitLab Duo reviews my merge requests, catching mistakes and helping me understand feedback from my teammates. It enhances my efficiency and aligns with GitLab‚Äôs…

item.title: What‚Äôs new in Git 2.52.0?
item.description: üöÄ Git has just released version 2.52! This update reintroduces the usual 12-week cycle after a brief 8-week one. A key feature is the new git-last-modified(1) command, which efficiently retrieves the last commit for each file in a commit, reducing processing load. Other improvements include enhancements to git-fast-export(1) and git-fast-import(1), making them better at handling cryptographic signatures. For repository maintenance, a new geometric strategy in git-maintenance(1)…

item.title: Achieve CMMC Level 2 with GitLab Dedicated for Government
item.description: üöÄ The U.S. Department of Defense has introduced new compliance requirements for Defense Industrial Base (DIB) companies under the CMMC Final Rule. Companies must now apply NIST 800-171 and undergo audits by Third-Party Assessment Organizations (3PAO) every three years. üíº GitLab Dedicated for Government offers a solution with its FedRAMP Moderate Authorization. This allows DIB companies to use the platform without extra audits, easing the compliance burden. üîç The Shared Responsibility Matrix…

item.title: Secure AI agent deployment to GKE
item.description: üöÄ Deploying AI agents to Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) is made simple with GitLab’s integration! This tutorial covers how to set up secure deployments, offering full control over your infrastructure and seamless CI/CD integration. Key benefits include: - Full infrastructure control - No complex workarounds - Automatic scaling Prepare by enabling necessary APIs and creating your GitLab project and GKE cluster before diving into the deployment process. #AIAgents #GoogleCloud #GitLab…

item.title: Migrate from pipeline variables to pipeline inputs for better security
item.description: üöÄ GitLab is enhancing CI/CD security by migrating from pipeline variables to pipeline inputs. Pipeline variables can be overridden without validation, posing security risks. In contrast, pipeline inputs offer explicit declarations, type safety, and built-in validation, improving overall maintainability and governance. To transition, restrict pipeline variables and configure roles effectively. This ensures a more secure CI/CD environment. Learn more about the migration process and its…

item.title: Claude Sonnet 3.7 deprecation notice for GitLab Duo
item.description: üö® Important Update for GitLab Duo Users! üö® Anthropic is deprecating Claude Sonnet 3.7. As a result, GitLab will remove support for this model in version 18.8, scheduled for January 15, 2026. üìÖ Current Status: Claude Sonnet 3.7 is still available. üîÑ Action Needed: Migrate to Claude 4.0+ models now. For further details, check the resources or contact GitLab Support for assistance. #GitLab #AI #ClaudeSonnet #Migration #TechUpdates

item.title: What is a YAML file? A complete guide from basics to practical use
item.description: üìÑ YAML is a widely used data serialization format, known for its clarity and simplicity. It’s often utilized in configuration files and playbooks, especially in tools like Kubernetes and Ansible. üîç Key comparisons include YAML vs. JSON, highlighting YAML’s use of indentation for better readability. The article also discusses YAML vs. CUE, emphasizing CUE’s schema validation features. ‚úèÔ∏è Understanding YAML syntax, such as indentation and data structures, is crucial for effective use. The…

item.description: üöÄ Software development teams often juggle multiple tasks under tight deadlines. The planning overhead can hinder strategic thinking, leading to missed opportunities. This tool helps product managers reduce overhead, improve alignment, and enhance predictability in their projects. Key features include: - Prioritization using frameworks like RICE and MoSCoW. - Efficient work breakdown…

item.title: Modernize Java applications quickly with GitLab Duo with Amazon Q
item.description: üöÄ Modernizing Java applications just got easier with GitLab Duo and Amazon Q! Upgrading from Java 8 to Java 17, which once took weeks, can now be done in minutes. Simply create an issue in GitLab and trigger the transformation with a command. The automated process analyzes your code, updates dependencies, and generates merge requests for review‚Äîall while maintaining functionality. This means less time on upgrades and more on new features! For more details, check out the full walkthrough!…

item.title: Delivering faster and smarter scans with Advanced SAST
item.description: üöÄ GitLab’s Advanced SAST is enhancing static application security testing to improve developer workflows. With the latest updates, teams can expect faster scans, increased accuracy, and the ability to create custom detection rules. üîç These enhancements, like multi-core and diff-based scanning, significantly reduce scan times, making security integration seamless. üí° By prioritizing both speed and accuracy, GitLab aims to drive SAST adoption and secure software development. #DevSecOps #GitLab…

item.title: GitLab 18.5: Intelligence that moves software development forward

Claude Haiku 4.5 enables multi-agent orchestration, allowing efficient parallel task execution. This integration supports faster iterations and improved AI assistance within GitLab’s ecosystem. item.title: Variable and artifact sharing in GitLab parent-child pipelines
item.description: üöÄ In the world of software development, adapting to evolving needs is essential. The article discusses the significance of CI/CD pipelines, specifically the parent-child pipeline model in GitLab. üîó This approach breaks complex pipelines into smaller, manageable child pipelines, improving functionality and efficiency. It also covers how to share variables and artifacts between these pipelines for streamlined operations. üìä Key benefits include conditional execution, parallel processing, and…

item.title: How we built a structured Streamlit Application Framework in Snowflake
item.description: üöÄ The GitLab Data team has unified scattered Streamlit applications into a structured framework for Snowflake. This framework improves security, simplifies deployment, and enhances collaboration across roles: Maintainers, Creators, and Viewers. Key takeaways include the importance of governance, automation, and compliance from day one. Learn how to streamline your applications today! #DataEngineering #Streamlit #Snowflake #DevOps #Automation

item.title: Optimize GitLab object storage for scale and performance
item.description: Managing GitLab at scale requires careful object storage setup for optimal performance and security. Utilize a consolidated form for GitLab components to streamline configurations and enable encrypted S3 buckets. For container registries, a separate setup with the new s3_v2 driver is necessary. Ensure you disable proxy downloads for better performance and adopt identity-based authentication methods for improved security. #GitLab #ObjectStorage #CloudComputing #DevOps #DataSecurity üåêüîêüì¶

GitLab offers a strategic solution by focusing on key artifact formats, helping to reduce operational overhead and improve efficiency. Their capabilities include lifecycle management, security integration, and deep CI/CD support. For teams looking to…

item.title: Atlassian ending Data Center as GitLab maintains deployment choice
item.description: Atlassian has announced that its Data Center products will reach end-of-life by March 28, 2029. This shift requires many organizations to rethink their DevSecOps strategies. GitLab offers a range of deployment options, including self-managed, cloud, and hybrid solutions, ensuring flexibility and compliance for diverse business needs. For companies relying on self-managed deployments, this change poses challenges, particularly in regulated industries where compliance and data security are…

item.title: How GitLab transforms embedded systems testing cycles
item.description: üöÄ Embedded developers face long waits for testing cycles, often leading to delays in bug fixes and product releases. GitLab addresses these challenges with managed lifecycle environments, which automate virtual testing without the complexities of traditional setups. This innovative approach ties testing environments to merge requests, ensuring persistence throughout feature development while eliminating unnecessary rebuilds and reducing costs. Discover how GitLab transforms embedded systems…

item.title: Agentic AI guides and resources

item.title: GitLab Duo Agent Platform adds support for Model Context Protocol
item.description: üöÄ GitLab Duo Agent Platform now supports the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enhancing the integration of AI in development. MCP provides AI secure access to internal systems, enabling developers to retrieve real-time information directly within their IDE. This reduces context switching and allows for a smoother workflow. With MCP, AI tools can connect reliably to various systems while maintaining security and privacy. Explore the capabilities of GitLab‚Äôs MCP in your development environment…

item.title: A comprehensive guide to GitLab DAST
item.description: üîí Modern businesses rely heavily on web applications, making security essential. It detects issues like authentication flaws, input validation vulnerabilities, and more. üîÑ By adopting DAST, teams can reduce costs, speed up deployment, and empower…

item.title: How we supercharged GitLab CI statuses with WebSockets
item.description: üöÄ We’ve made significant improvements to GitLab’s CI job status updates by reducing API calls by 92.56%! In 2025, we’ve shifted from legacy polling to WebSockets, allowing real-time updates without unnecessary network traffic. This change means users now see job status updates instantly instead of waiting up to 30 seconds. With GraphQL subscriptions, we‚Äôve transformed how data is fetched, resulting in just 3.4 million calls per day, down from 45 million. Stay tuned as we work on implementing…

item.title: Custom admin roles are now GA

item.title: Embedded views: The future of work tracking in GitLab
item.description: üìä Tired of switching tabs in GitLab to track your projects? Introducing Embedded Views! This feature, available in version 18.3, allows you to access live, relevant data directly within your workflow. No more outdated reports or endless context switching. With GitLab Query Language (GLQL), you can pull real-time data right where you need it, enhancing collaboration and maintaining context. Learn how this can transform your team’s work tracking! üöÄ #GitLab #ProjectManagement…

item.title: GitLab 18.3: Expanding AI orchestration in software engineering
item.description: üöÄ GitLab 18.3 is here, enhancing AI orchestration in software engineering! The platform now integrates AI at three levels: a unified data repository, a control plane for software delivery, and a streamlined user experience. This aims to boost productivity and simplify workflows. Key updates include the introduction of AI agents, expanded integrations, and enhanced context awareness for improved collaboration. Explore the future of DevSecOps with GitLab! üåü #GitLab #DevSecOps #AIIntegration…

item.title: What‚Äôs new in Git 2.51.0?
item.description: üöÄ Git has released version 2.51, with key updates aimed at improving performance and user experience. üîß Notable changes include enhanced git-push(1) and git-fetch(1) commands, which now use batched updates for reference synchronization, resulting in up to 22x speed improvements. üì¶ The release also introduces the “reftable” format as the default reference backend, addressing limitations of the previous “files” backend. üîë Additionally, SHA-256 is now the default hash function, enhancing…

item.title: Why financial services choose single-tenant SaaS
item.description: Financial institutions face unique challenges with shared infrastructure, which heightens systemic risks. As highlighted by JPMorgan Chase’s CISO, incidents on multi-tenant platforms can lead to widespread disruptions. GitLab Dedicated offers a solution, providing isolated environments for development while ensuring compliance and security. This approach enables institutions to manage risks more effectively, ensuring their source code is treated as a critical asset. Learn more about how…

item.title: GitLab uncovers Bittensor theft campaign via PyPI
item.description: üö® GitLab’s Vulnerability Research team has uncovered a cryptocurrency theft campaign targeting the Bittensor ecosystem via typosquatted Python packages on PyPI. Multiple malicious packages mimicked legitimate ones, published within a 25-minute window. These were designed to steal funds during staking operations, bypassing user confirmations and draining wallets silently. The attackers used a typosquatting strategy, exploiting common errors to increase the likelihood of installation. GitLab is…

Learn how to implement a hybrid analytics solution for measuring AI productivity and make informed decisions for…

item.title: Migrating by direct transfer is generally available
item.description: üöÄ GitLab 18.3 introduces direct transfer for migrating groups and projects, making it easier for users to copy resources between instances. This feature simplifies the migration process, allowing you to move entire top-level groups with sub-groups and projects without manual file exports. It supports user contribution mapping and works reliably with large projects. For those using GitLab.com, the feature is enabled by default. Self-managed users should check their application settings. üåê…

item.title: Securing AI together: GitLab‚Äôs partnership with security researchers
item.description: GitLab is enhancing security in AI with the support of external researchers. As AI evolves, so do the challenges, like prompt injection attacks. Our collaboration with organizations like Persistent Security helps us identify vulnerabilities and implement fast solutions. By engaging with the security research community, we aim to protect customers and ensure a secure development environment. Join us in our mission at GitLab! ü§ùüîí #AISecurity #CyberSecurity #GitLab #Collaboration #SoftwareSafety
